unique_users: Consultorio de Alergia e Inmunología - Dr. Juan Carlos Ivancevich

selected_quotes: Statins can cause an autoimmune muscle condition; it's rare (1/10,000) a succinct review-
Review describes characteristics, diagnosis, treatment of statin-associated autoimmune myopathy.
In rare cases, statins can cause a statin-associated autoimmune myopathy —
(NEJM) Miopatía autoinmune asociada a estatinas Revisión
Review article in @nejm Statin-Associated Autoimmune Myopathy #rheumedu #myositis

citation.abstract: Statins are widely used and lower the risk of death from cardiovascular causes. In a fraction of patients, an autoimmune myopathy may develop, characterized by the development of autoantibodies to the target enzyme, HMG-CoA reductase.
citation.title: Statin-Associated Autoimmune Myopathy

news.title: RheumNow: Statin-Induced Autoimmune Myopathy
news.summary: savesaved The CDC estimates that nearly 71% of adults with cardiovascular disease and 54% of adults with hypercholesterolemia use a cholesterol-lowering medication, and that "statin" use has grown significantly in recent years.

blogs.title: Statin-Associated Autoimmune Myopathy
blogs.summary: Statins significantly reduce the incidence of cardiovascular disease, are generally safe, and have an acceptable side-effect profile. It is now recognized, however, that in very rare cases, an autoimmune myopathy develops in patients treated with statins;

author.name: Now@NEJM
author.description: A Blog for Physicians About NEJM

blogs.summary:
